intro: Brucea ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty brucea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces orange-red berries that contain toxic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine. Brucea ferruginea thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and pharmacological research.
